kobold-comment: First, replace the player animation array an empty one
This is much better than calling over 200 individual remove operations (seriously, why)
Second, reconstruct the entire array with a single addeach, with all animations from latest vanilla game stable version
If this ever is changed in an update, new animations will simply not play and be easy to catch
This avoids needing to reference by index entirely and makes updating the mod WAY easier,
as you can just copy-paste any new animations visually into where they should be, instead of needing to adjust every index.
NOTE: Rotation and offsets should be swapped for better readability, but vanilla orders them this way so w/e.
Finally, remove seraph vanilla textures, and replace allAngles, entityTextureMode, and elements to define the kobold 3d model armature
/elements MUST be a replace operation to work properly
